main event: A ground-visual observation of a bullet-shaped object near Waccamaw River in Georgetown, South Carolina on March 11, 1957.
interesting points: The object was approximately the diameter of a penny and had a slight color break possibly red behind it., The observation lasted only 3 seconds., The observer was duck hunting and noted the object at a 15-20 degree angle above the horizon., The object faded out of sight after some time and seemed to follow the curvature of the Earth., The conclusion reached was that the duration of the observation was too short for it to be a rocket or missile, indicating it might have been a meteor sighting.
